chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jones Decorah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (10th or More) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.   AMENDED 04-14-2016:  CFTS (credit previously granted was duplicate to credit already granted in 07CF625)
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Preliminary hearing on May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive at all.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jones Decorah in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Jones Decorah in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
